title: Week 1: [Project Setup & Meetings]
text: Role this week: Scrum master + Data team leader

title: Week 1: [Project Setup & Meetings]
text:
What was done ?

Team organization
As a scrum master, I took care of leading the discussion regarding the organization of my 9 developers team.
We came to this structure:





%%{init: {'theme': 'base', 'themeVariables': { 'primaryColor': '#ffffff', 'edgeLabelBackground':'#f8f9fa', 'tertiaryColor': '#e9ecef', 'fontFamily': 'Inter, system-ui, sans-serif', 'nodeBorder': '#495057', 'mainBkg': '#ffffff', 'textColor': '#212529'}}}%%

flowchart TB
    classDef team fill:#3498db,stroke:#2980b9,stroke-width:2px,color:white,rx:8,ry:8,padding:10px;
    classDef subteam fill:#2ecc71,stroke:#27ae60,stroke-width:2px,color:white,rx:8,ry:8,padding:10px;
    classDef person fill:#ffffff,stroke:#95a5a6,stroke-width:1.5px,color:#2c3e50,rx:6,ry:6,padding:8px;

    A["Application"]:::team
    B["Captors"]:::team
    C["Data"]:::team
    
    A --> Simon["Simon"]:::person
    A --> Robin["**Robin**"]:::person
    
    B --> Filip["Filip"]:::person
    B --> Ana["Ana"]:::person
    B --> Yolan["**Yolan**"]:::person
    
    C --> Storage["Storage"]:::subteam
    C --> Processing["Processing"]:::subteam
    
    Storage --> Vincent["Vincent"]:::person
    Storage --> Olivier["**Olivier**"]:::person
    
    Processing --> Loic["Loic"]:::person
    Processing --> Unal["Unal"]:::person

    linkStyle default stroke:#bdc3c7,stroke-width:1.5px;






It should be noted that the bold names represent team leaders, who will have an extra weekly meeting (based on my suggestion).
We also had to agree to a rotation of the scrum master, product owner and client relationship roles
Here is what we agreed on:

Development environment setup
I setup a basic development environment including a project repository (see github)
This includes:

a basic README file,
a small project website made with quarto deployed to a github page through a github action (see action)

I also convinced my classmates to use github policies as follow:

Each feature must be developed on a separate branch
A pull request needs to be made to evaluate a feature
The feature pull requests need to be verified by at least 2 other individuals, including 1 from another team



Collaborative environment setup
I convinced my fellow colleagues to use Jira. This decision was motivated by the fact that’s it’s an industry standard.
We also setup the according teams, with specific filters to help people quickly what task they need to do (as seen on Figure 1 )






Figure 1: Jira filters overview





Kick off meeting
On Tuesday morning, we had a meeting with the CEO and CTO of our company (5MM).
During this meeting, we were asked to introduce ourselves, and come to agreement regarding the different positions within the group.
As this week scrum master, I was successfully able to keep the meeting easy going and focused on the things that needed to be done.


Sprint 1 planning
The planning of the first sprint was elaborated on Tuesday afternoon
You can see on Figure 2 bellow what we came up with






Figure 2: Jira dashboard overview

title: Week 1: [Project Setup & Meetings]
text:
What skills does this demonstrate

Data Engineering Competencies

CI/CD & Automation: Deployed GitHub Actions workflow for Quarto → GitHub Pages publishing.
Git Workflow Design: Implemented feature-branch strategy with mandatory cross-team PR reviews.
Documentation-as-Code: Built living docs (README + Quarto site) for onboarding and reference.



Computer Science Engineering Competencies

Toolchain Selection: Introduced Jira, GitHub, and Quarto as an integrated, industry-standard stack.
Process Engineering: Defined branching, PR, and verification policies balancing speed and quality.
Team Architecture: Organized 9 developers into 3 functional subteams with clear leadership paths.



Professional Skills (soft skills)

Agile Facilitation: Led Sprint 1 planning and Scrum Master rotation for shared ownership.
Stakeholder Management: Kept kick-off with CEO/CTO focused on roles and deliverables.
Consensus Building: Advocated successfully for GitHub policies and Jira adoption.
Proactive Coordination: Designed role-rotation schedule to build versatility and prevent burnout.
